butools.moments.MomsFromReducedMoms

butools.moments.MomsFromHankelMoms

butools.moments.HankelMomsFromMoms¶

butools.moments.HankelMomsFromMoms()¶
Matlab: rm = HankelMomsFromMoms(m)
Mathematica: rm = HankelMomsFromMoms[m]
Python/Numpy: rm = HankelMomsFromMoms(m)

Returns the Hankel moments given the raw moments.

The raw moments are: \(m_i=E(\mathcal{X}^i)\)

The ith Hankel moment is the determinant of matrix \(\Delta_{i/2}\), if i is even, and it is the determinant of \(\Delta^{(1)}_{(i+1)/2}\), if i is odd. For the definition of matrices \(\Delta\) and \(\Delta^{(1)}\) see [R15].

Parameters:

m : vector of doubles

The list of raw moments (starting with the first moment)
Returns:

hm : vector of doubles

The list of Hankel moments

References

[R15](1, 2) http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stieltjes_moment_problem

Examples

For Matlab:

>>> hm=HankelMomsFromMoms([1.3 2.4 6.03 20.5 89.5 474.9])
[1.3 0.71 2.079 1.9973 13.841 44.916]
>>> m=MomsFromHankelMoms(hm)
[1.3 2.4 6.03 20.5 89.5 474.9]

For Mathematica:

>>> hm=HankelMomsFromMoms[{1.2, 5, 38}]

For Python/Numpy:

>>> hm=HankelMomsFromMoms([1.2, 5, 38])
